channel.title: Linux on MOK's Onomatomaniske Kaos

item.title: Testing Compression Algorithms
item.description: Today I tested out various compression programs that are available on macOS/Linux. The compression programs used TL;DR: Never mind, take me to Results! GNU gzip GNU Gzip is the most used and loved compression program in the Linux/macOS world. Originally written by Jean-loup Gailly and Mark Adler for the GNU project. It has been the standard compression program used for many years in the open source community, and is a well established standard, not least for tar.
